page.title: 11Grimshaw Hall, Knowle
page.content: Grimshaw Hall is one of the oldest houses in Knowle. it is said that a ghost 'walks' in one of the bedrooms. The ghost is a beautiful lady dressed for a ball who was murdered by a jealous lover. There are 18 rooms in Grimshaw Hall and downstairs there are inglenook fireplaces so big that you can stand in them. When you look up the tall chimney you can see the sky. In the hall you can see a window with writing on. It was scratched with a diamond and said:Nancy Grimshaw and Fanny Grimshaw: and a message:'My gray has had ye day' when her horse won a race. The timber beams made beautiful patterns of diamonds, triangles and squares. The tall Tudor chimneys were built of small re bricks and rose in close groups from the roofs.
